name: Server FRC build (FTR 14/Rogue 4/DwD 22) (based on Cinnabar Din's "The Resistor")
author: Templar

So issues are:
I'm running into is This is for FRC and due to the extreamly slow experience gain... You really never expect to get to lvl 40.... EVER.
Feats i'm locked into for rp/story reasons are bastard sword spec's and imp expertise (because without it, EVERYTHING seems to hit me every time)

I'd like to keep knockdown and fit imp disarm in somewhere earlier and I take the epic damage resistance early on before epic weapon feats because Hitting things isn't as big an issue as not dieing from things hitting me so the less damage I take the better the survival chances.

Skill wise... appraise/spell craft choice hasn't been made yet. still not sure which I should do. Also the spot doesn't seem like enough to matter so could sprinkle that somewhere else

Last thing is I really wish I could figure out where to put in the last point of con for a 22 con score. might actually be worth it to just hit 22 before moving back to bumping str up.... HP or AB? the eternal question lol

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
How much is that 3/- DwD DR worth to you?  The most obvious resolution is just to add more fighter levels and most likely in pre-epic so as not to muck up your epic feat selections.  I'm betting you could easily find your Grt CON feat that way.  However...

Seeing as I am unfamiliar with your server, how available are common potions and scrolls there?  Since you'll have adequate UMD to use Protection from Elements scrolls, I don't see the value in going into elemental resistance feats.  Reading scrolls (like for rebuffing dispelled protections) during combat should be fairly straight-forward vs. most melee foes...  gulp an Invis potion then buff to your heart's content.  Worst case scenario, carry a few Darkness scrolls which typically foils monster AI.

The main question I have is:  If you NEVER (your own qualifier) expect to reach Level 40, what level DO you expect to reach?  Whatever that number, then THAT should be the target for your build plans rather than towards a Level 40 one.  It's more important to optimize toward a feasible target than an unreachable one.  In doing so, you may find that that you concern about rounding out abilities disappears.

posts.author: Templar
posts.content:
scrolls are fairly common, especially elemental resistance ones as they are all mostly low lvl stuff.

Point true on the not worrying about rounding out abilities. due to the extreamly slow lvl'ing nature .... mid to high 20's at most... I think in the life of the server there's only been like... 4 characters in the 30's range... ever....

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I approached this like a HotU build, hence the Lvl 28 cap.  This generally reflects the goals of the build you posted but optimized better for your anticipated level cap.

DwD 18 is not possible within the cap constraints, unfortunately,  You'd lose too many feats and/or AC/skills pursuing that route.

Whenever you take dwarf or half-orc in combination with a UMD dump, always dump on 4, 9, 14, 19, etc. due to the race penalty to CHA (assuming you are not intending to allocate any points to CHA during leveling).

I prefer to boost AB as soon as possible to hit creatures.  Every miss is another free attack for the enemy to land a hit or worse, a crit.  Same goes for ImpCrit... the sooner the better to do enough damage to eliminate flankers as soon as possible.  This is especially important in Expertise mode where your AB will be pitiful.

I did slide the Will save (-2 WIS) into Fort and HP (+2 CON) though, seeing as this was intended to be a "wall-ish" toon.  Seems like enough HP to last pretty long under most conditions.  Be sure to rush all mages before they cast a Bigby or Missile Storm.

Oh, yes, almost forgot... the UMD number may look strange not being in 5 rank increments.  I am assuming your server uses the hardcore UMD skill check for scrolls, in which case every rank matters. As a matter of fact, unless I have a net UMD level of 33, my toon always chugs down an Eagle potion before reading scrolls.  It can make the difference, believe me. As it stands now, this UMD level @Lvl 28 will succeed all scroll castings of Level 5 100% with an increase of failure of 5% per additional spell level. i.e. Level 9 scrolls will suffer 20% failure without prior CHA buffing.

Ftr 10 / Rog 4 / DwD 14, Dwarf; LG,LN or LE

STR: 16
DEX: 14
CON: 17 (24)
WIS: 8
INT: 14
CHA: 6

HP@Lvl28: 522
Saves (F/W/R) 24/12/14 (29/17/19 vs spells)
Other saves: Traps: +1, Poison: +2
BAB: 23
AB (max, naked): 29 (melee), 25 (ranged)
AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 20/30 (with Armor Skin)

01: Ftr(1): WP Exotic, WF: Bastard Sword
02: Ftr(2): Dodge
03: Ftr(3): Blind Fight
04: Rog(1): CON+1 (18)
05: Ftr(4): WS: Bastard Sword
06: Ftr(5): KD
07: Ftr(6): Expertise
08: Ftr(7): CON+1 (19)
09: Ftr(8): Toughness, IC: Bastard Sword
10: DwD(1)
11: DwD(2)
12: DwD(3): CON+1 (20), Imp Expertise
13: DwD(4)
14: Rog(2)
15: DwD(5): IKD
16: DwD(6): CON+1 (21)
17: DwD(7)
18: DwD(8): Disarm
19: DwD(9)
20: DwD(10): CON+1 (22)
21: Ftr(9): EWF: Bastard Sword
22: Ftr(10): EWS: Bastard Sword
23: DwD(11)
24: Rog(3): CON+1 (23), Armor Skin (could sub Prowess here if having trouble hitting, or another EDR if +2AC has little value)
25: DwD(12)
26: DwD(13)
27: DwD(14): EDR I, EDR II
28: Rog(4): CON+1 (24) [or, DwD for -1AC, +6HP, +1 Disc, -4 UMD]

Prime Skill Allocation
Discipline 30(33), Spellcraft 13(15), Tumble 30(32), UMD 31(29), remaining> 31 skill points to play with

posts.author: Templar
posts.content:

Explinations: With magic items being limited to +3 even on dm items and only casters being able to buff you up to +5 I've effectivly hit my AC cap.  I go for EDR1 and 2 at lvl 21 because as a tank I'm really going to be the most effective if I'm resisting the most damage I can. Right now I hit most everything decently so as for AB I think I will be ok, with rogue UMD points I can always use a scroll/potion/wand of truestrike if really needed as they do exist.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
If going a single rogue level in pre-epic, postpone it.  The longer the better.  Yes, I realize you will have more skill point to play with but that is ALL you achieve. No AC boost until your current level 22.

Postponing until 9 gains you +2AC and UMD enough to use magic equipment with value around 20K rather than 1K value items at level 1 (most wands cost more than 1K).  Sames goes for epic.  Postpone until at least 24 to use level 1 scrolls.  At  22, the most UMD you'll reach is 23 (25 - 2 @CHA 6) which won't be able to succeed in any scroll checks.   At UMD 25, at least you will be able to succeed level 1 scroll casts.  So... for each level after that, the UMD dump will guarantee success with the next spell level.

The other benefit postponing is not having struggle so hard to hit with a BAB 0 getting to level 2 while your HP will be 9 points.  Fighter will be BAB 1, HP 13 PLUS being able to equip plate/tower and bastard immediately.  You DO plan to tank immediately, right?

What I suggest is going through the wizard and cleric spell book and check the spells in the first 5 levels.  List any spells according to ascending sequence level you feel would benefit your toon and then try to estimate the availability on the server.   Start striking off spells on your list from highest to lowest until you reach a spell that could vastly change the effective in battle. Note the spell level.  Add that number to 25. Subtract 1 from the total.. That will be the rogue UMD dump level to assure your preferred spells will cast successfully every time.

"Potion of True Strike"?  So your server has some custom items, I see.  I have mixed emotions of the so-called True Strike "staple".  It takes a round to buff and then it expires in a round and a half.  Each buff via potion will be an AoO.  Sorry.  Outside of wiz or sorc with putrid AB trying to hit something without Tenser or some polymorph... I can't comprehend any usefulness unless just hoping for a lucky crit.  It's certainly not a viable alternative to just designing adequate AB into the build in the first place.  But you do have a lot of company.  Many players seem to believe True Strike buffs are awesome... until they try to use it during combat.

I would expect you will NOT be able to max Heal besides maintaining your primary combat skills (Disc, Tumble, Spcraft) and some UMD effectiveness with so few rogue levels but give it a shot.
Basically, your build plan traded 28 HPs and a Fort save for 1 AB/dmg and EDR III which is fine.  The fewer rogue levels will simply mean fewer overall skill ranks to distribute, a lower reflex save, -1d6 sneak and the loss of Uncanny Dodge which Defensive Awareness replaces anyway but an additional feat and 8HPs.  Only you can decide what the fewest number of dump levels can be before it begins to hamper the level-by-level playability and that comes down to play style and role.

Finally, TBH, at this pedestrian AB, Disarm seems pretty silly and am sure Cin realized the same. Medium weapons just don't disarm very well at all. I am betting successful attempts will disarm mages carrying daggers and little else, certainly totally ineffective versus creature weapons.  Go Armor Skin/Prowess for your best value.  Trust me. 

Oh, and just to eliminate the confusion, how about modifying the class split and ability spread to match your 28-level build, eh?

This is for a rebuild that I am hoping I can get. means I am rebuilding my old character at its current level.
This means that I don't need to worry about 0ab for the first two levels. I'm taking the rogue ONLY for skill points as on this server not having UMD effectivly means you can't solo cause you can't cast spells at all.  While I would rather not solo anyway, it seems to be what happens because I can't seem to connect to anyone or they are already in party with their nich group.
I see your point on the true strike potions. and I realize your right on the disarm as well. I've another chracter that uses a 2hander and is LOVING it but using a med weapon means its less effective so should probably skip it for something else.

... *edit the more recent post to reflect*

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I'm trying to follow your last reply but with a great deal of difficulty.  This what I've extrapolated so correct me if I've gone on a tangent...

You are rebuilding a toon starting at Level 22 so are stuck with your previous 21 levels.  If this is the case, you should have highlighted the levels that could not be changed and noted it on the build itself.

Sounds like it is too late to change much.  Pre-epic establishes what you will do in epic levels. Even the note on level 18 is meaningless now since you are well past it.  I doubt anyone will be able to provide much help on any build that has already been allocated this far.  If it were my build and I had indecision or just didn't plan well, I'd start a new toon because trying to correct things at this late date is futile.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: No, I think he means that he will be re-doing the levels he has so far, so he is only stuck with what he had at level 1.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Ahhh... so he created the toon as a rogue and is try to rebuild from 2.  I see.  Thanks for reorienting me, Empyre. ;)  I am in your debt, as usual.  His comment about "current level" is what threw me off. That's a shame due to losing the Tumble and UMD benefits by delaying a few more levels.  Ces't la vie!

In light of the revelation that this toon may be adopting a solo role rather than what was originally intended (party tank), you'll be forced to compensate for low AB that continues well into epic.

Expertise will be useful in some situations but I doubt Improved Expertise will help much with an effective AB of 8 at Level 15.  Perhaps PA/Cleave is the better choice since you'll get an attack at full BAB (AB 18 at that point) and can trigger while in Defensive Stance mode (Expertise turned off) and gain that much-needed AB.  TBH, toggling between Expertise and Defensive Stance is very buggy.  If you check the combat log, many times the bonuses won't apply after coming out of Expertise but the immobility makes it appear like they should.  I recommend you test this in a trainer before getting too reliant on the published claims.

posts.author: Templar
posts.content: to clarify, Full rebuild/recreation of previous character. so not even lvl 1 is fixed. In fact the current build i'm wanting to recreate was fighter/dwd so starting with rogue at level 1 is a full rebuild. just trying to keep close to the original intent of the character despite the build actually being made for a different server. I'm trying to get the remake to allow the character to properly flourish with the new server instead of butting my head against mechanics of the current server because my build was for a previous one.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: For that extra feat you not sure what to take, either take a feat to boost your weakest save by +2 (Iron Will or Lightning Reflexes, but probably not Great Fortitude), or delay all the other pre-epic feats and take Luck of Heroes at level 1 to boost all your saves by +1. Other than that, I think your build is fine for your purpose as-is.
